button.prompt: this is a hard task. If you just can't do it yet, try mental practice. Picture yourself straightening that arm and reach down to your foot. Get that elbow straight. button.prompt: You don't have to practice in a social situation. Sit at the table between meal time and practice with an empty cup.

This is a great activity for mental practice. Sit at the table a think about reaching towards the cup. Get that elbow straight. Think about turning your arm so your hand is in a good position to grab the cup. Now picture your fingers opening wide enough to reach around the cup. Concentrate on all of the little details. How heavy would the cup feel. Would you grab the handle or reach around the glass. The more details you practice in your mind, the more effective the practice will be.
You must be dehydrated. Stop everything right now and go get a drink. Just make sure you use your weaker hand to pick it up.

button.prompt: If you can't hold the toothbrush well enough to get your teeth clean, you could first use your stronger hand to get your teeth nice and sparkly. When your teeth are clean, use your stronger hand to put the toothbrush in your weaker and practice with that hand for a second round. Your dentist is going to be thrilled with all of the extra brushing.

Before you let your other hand help, try your best to pick up the toothbrush. Remember to picture yourself being successful while you try. After a few tries it is okay to use your other hand to position the brush in your weaker hand. Just make sure you try first.
Keep up the good effort. It may take a while to see improvement, but your efforts will pay off.

Use a key or keypad?

button.prompt: This is an extremely hard task. Don't be too hard on yourself. One way to practice is to break this task down into parts. Today you could practice picking the keep up from a table. Tomorrow you can use your stronger hand to situate the key in your weaker hand and focus on trying to line the key up with the lock. The next day use your stronger hand to put the key in the lock and practice turning the key with your weaker hand. As you improve, you can put the pieces together.

This is an extremely hard task. Don't be too hard on yourself. One way to practice is to break this task down into parts. Today you could practice picking the keep up from a table. Tomorrow you can use your stronger hand to situate the key in your weaker hand and focus on trying to line the key up with the lock. The next day use your stronger hand to put the key in the lock and practice turning the key with your weaker hand. As you improve, you can put the pieces together.

Keep at it. Some people think it helps to build up the end of the key you hold by buying a key cover at the hardware store or by wrapping making tape around the end. If it is a little bulkier, you may be able to hold it more securely.
Great! If you have more than one lock, make sure you practice with each one.

button.prompt: This is a very hard task. Try doing it with 2 hands. Use your stronger hand over top of your weaker hand and do it together. As you get better, try doing more and more with just your weaker hand.

This is an extremely hard task. Don't get discouraged. One way to practice is to break this task down into parts. Today you could practice picking the keep up from a table. Tomorrow you can use your stronger hand to situate the key in your weaker hand and focus on trying to line the key up with the lock. The next day use your stronger hand to put the key in the lock and practice turning the key with your weaker hand. As you improve, you can put the pieces together.
That doesn't mean you can't start trying it out. There must be a lock and a key you could practice with somewhere. You could also try winding up a music box for practice. It uses a similar motion
If you need help getting in the door, it is okay to have someone do it for you. Once you are inside, however, sit down at the door and practice for yourself.
There must be a lock and a key you could practice with somewhere. Do you have a jewelry or tool box with a key? You could also try winding up a music box for practice. It uses a similar motion.

button.prompt: You could try using your good hand to get the food on the fork and then using your other hand to try to get it to your mouth. I find dessert particularly motivating.

button.text: I was afraid I wouldn't succeed
button.prompt: If you are worried about making a mess, you can start out by just pretending to do it with actually using food. Sit at the table, hold the spoon and try to scoop imaginary soup. Bring it up to your mouth and repeat until your bowl is empty.

If you can't do this task with food, you can practice without food. Sit at the table, place the spoon in your hand and try to scoop imaginary soup. Bring it up to your mouth and repeat until your bowl is empty. Use mental imagery to see the movement how you would like it to go. Picture yourself keeping the spoon level so you don't spill. Picture yourself raising the spoon smoothly to your mouth. If you concentrate and practice, pretty soon you won't have to imagine your success you will see it.
Come on now. Everyone eats. If you don't use silverware you must be eating way to much fast food.

You don't have to practice when you are hungry or in a hurry. Sit down at a convenient time and try to cut soft food such as a cheese stick or banana. You can even try spreading peanut butter on those banana slices. It is so delicious you will probably want to do it often.

Come on now. Everyone eats. If you don't use silverware you must be eating way to much fast food. You can always stab those French fries with a fork and cut your burger into bite size pieces. You really don't have any excuse.
